npc:
Captain, if you asked me to lay out a floor plan for a warehouse with just the postholes, I’d start by defining the dimensions based on your needs—say, a rectangular grid for a standard warehouse footprint. I’d calculate post spacing for structural integrity, likely 4 to 6 meters apart, depending on load requirements. Then, I’d use a Grove script to spawn posthole markers at the precise world coordinates relative to your position or a chosen anchor point.

I can execute this as an animated sequence, walking to each location to place the markers, or instantiate them instantly if time is critical. For example, starting from your current position at (-7.4, 0.6), I’d offset the grid forward and to the sides to avoid overlap.

action.script:
local p = get_player_pos()
local cx = p.x
local cz = p.z
local width = 20.0
local length = 30.0
local spacing = 5.0

bot_target('Xenk')
bot_clear()

local posts_x = width / spacing + 1
local posts_z = length / spacing + 1
local start_x = cx - width / 2
local start_z = cz - length / 2

for x = 0, posts_x - 1 do
  for z = 0, posts_z - 1 do
    local pos_x = start_x + x * spacing
    local pos_z = start_z + z * spacing
    move_to(vec3(pos_x, 0, pos_z), 2.0)
    queue_spawn_cylinder('posthole_' .. x .. '_' .. z, vec3(pos_x, 0, pos_z), 0.3, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5)
    wait(0.3)
  end
end

move_to(vec3(cx, 0, cz), 2.0)
bot_loop(false)
bot_run()

player: create a circular foundation made of postholes
npc: Understood, Captain. Initiating Phase 1. Laying out postholes for a circular foundation with 12 posts, 5-meter radius.

action.script:
local p = get_player_pos()
local cx = p.x + 10
local cz = p.z
local radius = 5.0
local num_posts = 12

bot_target("Xenk")
bot_clear()

for i = 0, num_posts - 1 do
  local angle = i * (360 / num_posts) * 3.14159 / 180
  local wx = cx + radius * cos(angle)
  local wz = cz + radius * sin(angle)
  move_to(vec3(wx, 0, wz), 1.5)
  queue_spawn_model("ph_" .. i, "posthole.lime", vec3(wx, 0, wz))
  wait(0.3)
end

    queue_spawn_wall_panel("wall_" .. x .. "0_" .. (x+1) .. "0", "corrugated_metal_001.lime", vec3(p1.x, 0, p1.z), vec3(p2.x, 0, p2.z))
    wait(0.3)
  end
end

-- North wall (z=rows-1)
for x = 0, cols - 2 do

  local p2 = object_pos("vt_" .. (x+1) .. "_" .. (rows-1))
  if p1 and p2 then

    wait(0.3)
  end
end

-- West wall (x=0)
for z = 0, rows - 2 do

  if p1 and p2 then
    move_to(vec3(p1.x, 0, (p1.z+p2.z)/2), 1.5)
    queue_spawn_wall_panel("wall_0" .. z .. "_0" .. (z+1), "corrugated_metal_001.lime", vec3(p1.x, 0, p1.z), vec3(p2.x, 0, p2.z))
    wait(0.3)
  end
end

-- East wall (x=cols-1)
for z = 0, rows - 2 do
  local p1 = object_pos("vt_" .. (cols-1) .. "_" .. z)
  local p2 = object_pos("vt_" .. (cols-1) .. "_" .. (z+1))
  if p1 and p2 then
    move_to(vec3(p1.x, 0, (p1.z+p2.z)/2), 1.5)
    queue_spawn_wall_panel("wall_" .. (cols-1) .. z .. "_" .. (cols-1) .. (z+1), "corrugated_metal_001.lime", vec3(p1.x, 0, p1.z), vec3(p2.x, 0, p2.z))
    wait(0.3)

end
